intro: Oreopanax mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' sarsaparilla, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Oreopanax mathewsii is often found in humid, shaded environments within forest understories.
